definitions.definition: A position of power or influence, or a way to get it.
definitions.example: His parents got him an in with the company.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) One who, or that which, is in; especially, one who is in office.
The state of a batter/batsman who is currently batting; see innings.
A re-entrant angle; a nook or corner.
To enclose.
To take in; to harvest.
Located indoors, especially at home or at one's office or place of work.
Located inside something.
definitions.example: Little by little I pushed the snake into the basket, until finally all of it was in.

definitions.definition: (of the ball or other playing implement) Falling or remaining within the bounds of the playing area.
definitions.example: If the tennis ball bounces on the line then it's in.

definitions.definition: Inserted or fitted into something.
definitions.example: I've discovered why the TV wasn't working – the plug wasn't in!

definitions.definition: Having been collected or received.
definitions.example: The replies to the questionnaires are now all in.

definitions.definition: In fashion; popular.
Incoming.
(of the sails of a vessel) Furled or stowed.
Of the tide, at or near its highest level.
definitions.example: You can't get round the headland when the tide's in.

definitions.definition: With privilege or possession; used to denote a holding, possession, or seisin.
definitions.example: in by descent; in by purchase; in of the seisin of her husband

definitions.definition: Currently batting.
Having familiarity or involvement with somebody.
definitions.example: He is very in with the Joneses.

definitions.definition: Having a favourable position, such as a position of influence or expected gain, in relation to another person.
definitions.example: I think that bird fancies you. You're in there, mate!

definitions.definition: At or towards the interior of a defined space, such as a building or room.
definitions.example: He ran to the edge of the swimming pool and dived in.

definitions.definition: Towards the speaker or other reference point.
definitions.example: For six hours the tide flows in, then for another six hours it flows out.

definitions.definition: So as to be enclosed or surrounded by something.
definitions.example: Bring the water to the boil and drop the vegetables in.

definitions.definition: Still eligible to play, e.g. able to bat in cricket and baseball.
definitions.example: He went for the wild toss but wasn't able to stay in.

definitions.definition: After the beginning of something.
definitions.example: The show still didn't become interesting 20 minutes in.

definitions.definition: (in combination, after a verb) Denotes a gathering of people assembled for the stated activity, sometimes, though not always, suggesting a protest.
Used to indicate location, inclusion, or position within spatial, temporal or other limits.
Into.
definitions.example: Less water gets in your boots this way.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate limit, qualification, condition, or circumstance.
definitions.example: In replacing the faucet washers, he felt he was making his contribution to the environment.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate means, medium, format, genre, or instrumentality.
Abbreviation of inch; inches.
